titleStmt.title: Whereas the militia are by special orders of the government acually imployed in defense of the countrey, [sic] and many of them excuse their attendance, upon pretence that they are already inlisted in the Army, or intend to be so which we conceive very prejudicial to Their Majesties service
titleStmt.author: Cox, Richard, Sir, 1650-1733.

titleStmt.title: Whereas the militia are by special orders of the government acually imployed in defense of the countrey, [sic] and many of them excuse their attendance, upon pretence that they are already inlisted in the Army, or intend to be so which we conceive very prejudicial to Their Majesties service
titleStmt.author: Cox, Richard, Sir, 1650-1733.

notesStmt.note: "Dated at Cork the 25th day of June, 1691."
Reproduction of original in: Library Company of Philadelphia.
